body.name: Cabeau Evolution Classic Neck Support Pillow - Neck Pillow for Traveling - Memory Foam Airplane Pillow with 360-Degree Comfort - Head & Chin Support Pillows for Sleeping Upright - (Navy)

features: ULTIMATE TRAVEL PILLOW: Our memory foam travel pillow is the ideal car pillow for road trips or the perfect airplane neck pillow to catch some sleep on a long flight. Top off your travel kit with this premium support pillow to help avoid neck pain.

FALL ASLEEP & STAY ASLEEP: Carefully crafted and designed, this neck pillow for sleeping while traveling is made to help you fall asleep in any position. 360-degree support and front clasps cradle your head for stability to help you stay asleep.

ERGONOMIC MEMORY FOAM DESIGN: Unlike other neck pillows for travel, our dual-density memory foam pillow features raised side supports and a flat back for healthy spine positioning and comfort while resting.
WASHABLE COVER: No need to worry about those unwanted smells or dirty microbes, the Cabeau Evolution Classic Travel Pillow's removable cover makes it easy to wash – always fresh for your next trip.

DID YOU KNOW? The average person moves their head twice every hour while sleeping. The Cabeau Evolution Classic travel sleep pillow offers stability and minimizes neck movement in every sleeping position while traveling.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Adjustable Front Clasp An adjustable front clasp provides a customized fit for individual comfort. Our unique design provides 360-degree comfort. Raised Side Supports Raised side supports prevent lateral movement or "bobblehead" and keep you from drooling on your seat mate's shoulder. Slim Flattened Back The thin, flat back ensures perfect spine alignment, relaxes your back and releases tension that overstrains neck and shoulder muscles. Memory Foam Core Our premium memory foam core is protected by a moisture-wicking, machine-washable cover that keeps your neck dry and stays fresh-looking.
Previous page Next page 1 Comfort On-The-Go 2 A True Classic 3 Slim Flattened Back 4 Machine-Washable Cover 5 Fall Asleep & Stay Asleep

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best one!
reviews.reviewText: I tried a bunch of different random Amazon pillows before I finally got this one (recommended by my sister). It’s the best and worth a couple extra bucks to have an actual comfortable neck pillow. I used this on my trip to Switzerland and it was exactly what I needed. It’s soft, provides support, rolls up and stores away easily, and has a removable/washable cover. I mean if you’re looking for a travel pillow or really just a neck pillow for sitting long hours at your desk, this is great. For reference, I am a 5’2’’ petite person and this worked for me..also worked for my brother and boyfriend so it seems to be pretty standard fit. Worth it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Soft fabric like velvet or velour, and keep the orange packig strap!
reviews.reviewText: Good support, I am 5' 8" tall and have a long neck, this worked well for me. Neck and scapula issues! I like the firmness and holds my chin comfortably up which is what I needed. It is a flatter behind the nape of the neck, which my Phys. therapist recoemmended. due to needing to sit correctly with spine straight and not slouching chin forward. The airline seats do not work well if you have a bulging pillow behind your neck pushing your head forward. Another reviewer said keep the orange packing strap to fold it up and that was smart! You can also attach with little toggles to hang on your purse or bag. Easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Big, bulky, but soooo soft. For larger folks.
reviews.reviewText: The Cabeau pillow is really quite big and a bit awkward but it is gloriously soft and squishy. I confess it was sometimes TOO big and I would give up and toss it under my seat, but I wonder if I did not push through to figuring out how to use it? It would definitely be a better fit for larger people - small people would probably find it a bit big for their shoulders and neck. Because it's squishy, you might be able to fold it up into a pillow, and I suspect if you are waiting for a flight in an airport it might work well there as well. Take a look at it before you buy. Sorry, mine is packed away but you should be able to get a good sense of it from the sales imagery.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money
reviews.reviewText: I used this on my last flight and it was so much more supportive than my last neck pillow. I also love the string closure is adjustable and it can easily be tightly wound up in a compact ball to put inside my carry-on bag.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A cheaper alternative to the Evolution 3, but they cheaped up.
reviews.reviewText: I tried the Evolution 3 by this company and it's pretty good. The design is very good and the neck support is probably the best out there. What I didn't like was the thin, cheap fabric and cheap zipper. The zipper is very difficult to use and almost broke the first time I tried it. For $40 this shouldn't be happening. I also didn't care for the headrest straps. I found them annoying, and unusable for a short (under five feet) family member.So, I tried the Evolution Classic. It has most of the good features of the Evolution 3, without the straps, and with a more plush fabric. But, importantly, what they left out is a storage pouch. That's inexcusable. What this means is you have to carry this relatively bulky pillow around fully expanded, taking up a ton of room in your carry-on/backpack, or having to attach it to the outside of your carry-on. For $30, the company should have included a pouch with the pillow (almost every one else does), but they cheaped up and didn't. This pretty much forces you to shell out another $10 or so to get something to pack it in. As a consequence, you now have one of the more expensive travel pillows on the market. It also has the same cheap zipper as the Evolution 3, so be prepared for the hassle of it getting stuck or breaking.Do I recommend the Evolution Classic? Only if the lack of pouch to pack it in doesn't bother you. Otherwise, the Evolution 3 is a better deal if you're OK with the negatives I mentioned. Personally, I'm not bothering with either pillow, preferring another brand's superior design and quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome gift for frequent travelers
reviews.reviewText: Got this gift for my boyfriend as he travels often for work and constantly complains of neck/back issues. He absolutely loves it and brings it with him every trip! Great soft material, color as pictured online, and has a tempeurpedic feel to it. Also has adjustable drawstrings in the front to keep it tight and in place around your neck. Overall great purchase and worth the price

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pillow very comfortable and supportive.
reviews.reviewText: I had shoulder surgery and have had to sleep in my recliner and this neck pillow has been my saving grace to get some rest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Good idea but doesn’t work for me.
reviews.reviewText: I think this is well designed and would provide good support for both side and forward head position while sleeping during travel. However the implementation for me was poor and they should offer sizing. I am a 5’ 8” senior male and it was uncomfortable. It is made for a much longer neck than mine and was too high pushing up my ear lobes and hurting after a few minutes. Would be great if you had a long neck. It should be offered with different heights.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente producto, ayuda hasta para torceduras de cuello y migrañas
reviews.reviewText: Es la segunda vez que compro este modelo de almohada, me ayuda bastante no solo para viajar sino también para dolores de cuello y cabeza en el día a día. La funda se puede quitar fácilmente para lavarse, y la bolsita que trae a un lado es buenísima para guardar ya sea el celular, los audífonos, los earplugs o el antifaz para dormir. Lo único que no me queda claro es cómo limpiar el cojín de esponja de relleno, ya que si lo toca cualquier líquido lo absorbe rapidísimo y no logra secarse por dentro, y se apesta. Si lo metes a la secadora se rompe, y aunque lo dejes días enteros bajo el sol no se seca en absoluto (así le pasó a mi primera almohada, me duró 5 años hasta que intenté lavar el relleno y se rompió). Las instrucciones de lavado de la etiqueta no son nada claras. Pero fuera de eso esta almohada es una maravilla y es la mejor que he tenido. La recomiendo totalmente!!
Ne possiedo uno e questo l'ho acquistato da regalare. Rispetto al mio acquistato anni fa questo non ha la custodia.
Nicely designed nd comfortable for use gives a great support while on flights
Great product. comfortable product. 🚨🚨But to much costly.🚨🚨 Compare to other products.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent product but not worth the price
reviews.reviewText: This is an okay product. I like the color but initially, it stinks. If you wash the cover and keep the pillow in the open air for a few days, the smell goes away.Order this product only if you have time to clean it initially. The seller should keep this in account
